intro: Stenogyne kamehamehae, commonly known as the Kamehameha stenogyne, is a rare Hawaiian flowering plant belonging to the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue to white in color. The plant is endemic to the island of Hawaii and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is classified as critically endangered. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique species.
